alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a furan ring, which is a five-member aromatic ring with one oxygen atom, four carbon atoms.
alternative_parents.name: Furans

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing an aromatic ring where a carbon atom is linked to an hetero atom.
alternative_parents.name: Heteroaromatic compounds

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing a trialkylamine group, characterized by exactly three alkyl groups bonded to the amino nitrogen.
alternative_parents.name: Trialkylamines

alternative_parents.description: Compounds having the nitro group, -NO2 (free valence on nitrogen), which is attached to carbon.
alternative_parents.name: C-nitro compounds

alternative_parents.description: Organosulfur compounds a sulfenyl group with the general formula RS (R = organyl).
alternative_parents.name: Sulfenyl compounds

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing a dialkylamine group, characterized by two alkyl groups bonded to the amino nitrogen.
alternative_parents.name: Dialkylamines

alternative_parents.description: Organosulfur compounds containing a thioether group that is substituted by two alkyl groups.
alternative_parents.name: Dialkylthioethers

alternative_parents.description: Organic 1,3-dipolar compounds with the general structure  X#N+-Z- <-> X-=N+=Z <-> X-=N-Z+ <-> X-N=Z (X = C or O, Z = C, N, or O).
alternative_parents.name: Propargyl-type 1,3-dipolar organic compounds

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing an heterocycle with at least one oxygen atom linked to a ring carbon.
alternative_parents.name: Oxacyclic compounds

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds comprising the oxoazanium cation, with the formula N+=O.
alternative_parents.name: Organic oxoazanium compounds

alternative_parents.description: Organic salts that results from the reaction of hydrochloric acid with an organic base.
alternative_parents.name: Hydrochlorides

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing an oxide group.
alternative_parents.name: Organic oxides

alternative_parents.description: Derivatives of hydrocarbons obtained by substituting one or more carbon atoms by an heteroatom. They contain at least one carbon atom and heteroatom.
alternative_parents.name: Hydrocarbon derivatives

alternative_parents.description: Organic neutral compounds having formal unit electrical charges of opposite sign.
alternative_parents.name: Organic zwitterions

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing a bond between a carbon atom and an oxygen atom.
alternative_parents.name: Organooxygen compounds

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a bond between carbon a pnictogen atom. Pnictogens are p-block element atoms that are in the group 15 of the periodic table.
alternative_parents.name: Organopnictogen compounds

class.description: Organic compounds containing a nitrogen atom.
class.name: Organonitrogen compounds

description: This compound belongs to the class of organic compounds known as aralkylamines. These are alkylamines in which the alkyl group is substituted at one carbon atom by an aromatic hydrocarbyl group.

direct_parent.description: Alkylamines in which the alkyl group is substituted at one carbon atom by an aromatic hydrocarbyl group.
direct_parent.name: Aralkylamines

kingdom.description: Compounds that contain at least one carbon atom, excluding isocyanide/cyanide and their non-hydrocarbyl derivatives, thiophosgene, carbon diselenide, carbon monosulfide, carbon disulfide, carbon subsulfide, carbon monoxide, carbon dioxide, Carbon suboxide, and dicarbon monoxide.
kingdom.name: Organic compounds

subclass.description: Compounds formally derived from ammonia by replacing one, two or three hydrogen atoms by hydrocarbyl groups, and having the general structures RNH2 (primary amines), R2NH (secondary amines), R3N (tertiary amines).
subclass.name: Amines

superclass.description: Organic compounds containing a nitrogen atom.
superclass.name: Organic nitrogen compounds
